title: Kat Edmonson On Song Travels
description: Hear the arresting singer-songwriter perform her song "Long Way Home" with host Michael Feinstein.

title: All Songs +1: How Music Can Really Save Your Life
description: For this week's All Songs +1 podcast, we talk with NPR Music's Stephen Thompson about his most recent "Good Listener" column on the life-saving powers of music.

title: Songs We Love: Blanck Mass, 'Dead Format'
description: Benjamin John Power, one-half of the Olympic-scoring electronic duo F*** Buttons, takes a stab at dance music and draws blood.

title: Mitt Romney To Fight Evander Holyfield. You Read That Right
description: Former 2012 Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney is picking another fight — with Evander Holyfield, the former heavyweight champion of the world. It's all for a good cause.

title: Feds Tell Insurers To Pay For Anesthesia During Screening Colonoscopies
description: Most people are anesthetized during colonoscopy. Federal law mandates that the cancer test itself must be fully covered by insurers, but quite a few of them didn't pay for anesthesia.

title: Camané: Tiny Desk Concert
description: A major star of fado music in his native Portugal, Camané sings with a silky baritone — and the weight of the world's sadness on his shoulders.

title: Coup Leaders Arrested In Burundi As Uprising Is Quashed
description: The alleged mastermind of the failed putsch, Gen. Godefroid Niyombare, is reportedly still at large as President Pierre Nkurunziza reasserts his authority after returning from neighboring Tanzania.

title: Actor Johnny Depp's Dogs Are Flown Out Of Australia After Threat Of Destruction
description: Australia's agriculture minister said Depp sidestepped the country's laws because his dogs did not spend the required 10 days in quarantine. The minister threatened to destroy the dogs.

title: How Do You Get Your Colleagues To Trust You?
description: How do you create trust? Management theorist Simon Sinek says it starts with a leader who makes people feel safe.

title: How Can You Restore Trust In Government?
description: Former Greek Prime Minister George Papandreou says politicians like him have lost the trust of their citizens and it needs to be restored.

title: How Can Couples Rebuild Trust After An Affair?
description: Affairs can completely rock a marriage. But psychotherapist Esther Perel says that while infidelity can shatter trust, it doesn't mean couples can't find a way to rebuild their relationships.

title: How Can Trusting Strangers Fuel An Economy?
description: The new currency of this economy is trust, says Rachel Botsman. Companies that rely on sharing invest in what Botsman calls "reputation capital."

title: How Does Trust Happen In Music?
description: Conductor Charles Hazlewood talks about the role of trust between conductor and orchestra, which he describes as a "miracle."

title: Top Stories: B.B. King Dies; Missing U.S. Chopper Found
description: Also: Hundreds of migrants are towed to shore in Indonesia; Burundi arrests generals in an attempted coup; and the Minnesota Orchestra becomes the first major U.S. orchestra to play in Cuba in years.

title: Political Science Professor's Name Added To Presidential Survey
description: Emily Farris teaches at Texas Christian University. She joked her name should be added to a presidential survey. Public Policy Polling added it, and she's doing better than N.J. Gov. Chris Christie.
